Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Wed Nov  8 23:12:24 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.
Squidsoft.net Account Support and Maintenance: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/
If you do not yet have a Squidsoft.net account, type CREATE or visit the above
web address.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large PANEL of environmental controls here. Lights overhead indicate
that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in space. The hatch appears to be locked. A small green light near the
hatch marks that the airlock currently possesses a safe environment.
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Ok."
out
You may not leave the ship until the airlock's environment matches the external
environment.

your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.

here.

and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.

[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "One hint. Try to change only what they
ask you to change. Don't change 10 things that are ok in order to change the one
they want you to. Also, most things can be explained in one or two sentences."
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
[Newbie Help] Lexie Amarras transmits, "Try and avoid a lot of adjective stuff
and get to the heart of what you want. It's better to have something reads super
simplistic than to have something overly complicated, at least that's how it
seemed when I was doing it."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Helps if you put your work in a word
processor and save it, copy and paste from there to your client when you do the
profile attempts. That way you can edit what you already had easily."
The computer reports the presence of an artifact.
The starship transitions into another sector.
Proper in-sector coordinates not reached.  AutoVector program aborted.
[Newbie Help] Lexie Amarras transmits, "You can elaborate somewhat when you do
the profile."

[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "You will find that if you have frequent
spelling errors and don't seem to care, you will have issues. Hosts want the
game to be presentable. And constant spelling errors make things harder on the
rest of the players. So improving your spelling is a good thing in general, and
a good thing for playing SC."

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.

your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."

[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Why does it say [n/a] before all PA
messages in ships?"
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "Are you sure that's not a client thing?"
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Yeah."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Umm...are you using a screen reader? If
so, your client might be parsing some ansi code as text?"
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "No screen reader."
[Newbie Help] Evangeline Adaire transmits, "It doesn't say that with me, weird."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Not for me either."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "I'm not seeing this either."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "Support I'd think."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Could still be the client parsing
something. Are you using colors on it?"
[PA] [Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "[n/a]Person: "Boom.""
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "I would say support that."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Alrighty, thanks."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Problem found: color nine is bugged for
me for some reason. Changing the PA color fixed it."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "What color should that be?"
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Ah. That's why I asked about colors. I
don't have a color set for it personally because last I knew it colored the
entire line. If they make it where it colors only part of it like the comms I
will. But for now it's just easier for me to read with no color at all. You can
set it to whatever you like though."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Do you know what color color nine is
meant to be? It's blank on my screen."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Let me check."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Possibly black?"
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Seems so. Huh. Thanks."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "But yes, it's blank on mine as well."

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You may not leave the starship while it is moving.
out
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?

You are weightless here.

green.

ftl 275
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Alpha 275."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
[0m04:10[0m
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing an electric blue synthcotton shipsuit with a spiral galaxy
printed on the chest. She is also wearing a light purple flightbag with a pastel
kitten on the side, an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, an elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a

cargo, so I can't launch. But I am 'in the middle of transferring', so I cannot
sell the stuff I do have."
[Newbie Help] Johann Schraft transmits, "Are you saying your cargo is overfull?"

forgotten to transfer first. Now I cannot transfer nor fly this ship."
[Newbie Help] Johann Schraft transmits, "What ship?"
[Newbie Help] Kim Saunders transmits, "Does your ship still have charge?"
[Newbie Help] Aya Navarro transmits, "It's a newbie cargo ship. It has 100%
charge."
[Newbie Help] Aya Navarro transmits, "It's docked or landed in a spaceport,
even."
[Newbie Help] Johann Schraft transmits, "What does it say when you try to
launch?"
[Newbie Help] Lily Kaise transmits, "Have you powered down and then back up and
if that doesn't work, logoff and then lock back in?"
[Newbie Help] Aya Navarro transmits, "You may not launch while transferring
cargo. When I try to transfer, 'The computer reports that cargo is already being
transferred'. I've powered down and back up. Trying logging and relogging now."
[Newbie Help] Johann Schraft transmits, "That does sound like a bug. Maybe
support about it?"
[Newbie Help] Aya Navarro transmits, "Relogging didn't help, unfortunately.
There was a crash yesterday before I had to log; possible culprit?"

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.

cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons, a cup of hot French vanilla
coffee, and a cup of hot French vanilla coffee here.
You can go south and out.
vector s

The starship transitions into another sector.
get covfee

get coffee
You pick up a cup of hot French vanilla coffee.
The starship transitions into another sector.
drink coffee
Your helmet prevents this.
drop coffee
You put down a cup of hot French vanilla coffee.

         _______    ** ** **      ** **    **   ___________

                                \_/
Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Wed Nov  8 23:12:24 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.
Squidsoft.net Account Support and Maintenance: http://moo.squidsoft.net:3333/
If you do not yet have a Squidsoft.net account, type CREATE or visit the above
web address.
Please log in now.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons, a cup of hot French vanilla
coffee, and a cup of hot French vanilla coffee here.
You can go south and out.
**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 Star Conquest takes a lot of money to run. Please consider donating to offset
those costs.
 Type HELP DONATIONS for more information.
**
 TIP: As a pilot you want both license points and credits, but most activities
focus on one or the other.
**

You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You may not leave the starship while it is moving.
out
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons, a cup of hot French vanilla
coffee, and a cup of hot French vanilla coffee here.
You can go south and out.

l
[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You see an oddly-designed wormhole drive construct here.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.

telescoping xenology container.

You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.

cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.

You are weightless here.
You carefully open the hatch and float outside.

put knife in cont

w
[Outside Celestial Explorer]
You can go in any direction using a spacejet, or return to Celestial Explorer.

enter
Wait 13 seconds.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons, a cup of hot French vanilla
coffee, and a cup of hot French vanilla coffee here.
You can go south and out.
vector w
You make a selection on the AutoVector control board.
The computer reports the presence of an artifact.
The starship transitions into another sector.
Proper in-sector coordinates not reached.  AutoVector program aborted.
move

wait.

out
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."

l
[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You see a piece of something oddly similar to a set of medieval plate armor
here.

You are weightless here.

enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons, a cup of hot French vanilla
coffee, and a cup of hot French vanilla coffee here.
You can go south and out.

You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
enter

[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You see a sphere of cohesive slow-flowing liquid here.

You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.
(17 seconds roundtime.)
put cube in cont
Wait 10 seconds.
put cube in cont
You pick up a dense cube-shaped metallic mass.
You put a dense cube-shaped metallic mass into a large expandable telescoping
xenology container.

[Outside Celestial Explorer]
You can go in any direction using a spacejet, or return to Celestial Explorer.

enter

enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
out
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?

stop

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
ftl 275
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Alpha 275."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
[0m04:23[0m
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.
move
AutoStar detects 27 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
--
AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Temporary Stations:

A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: League Rapid Recharging
Eatery & Battery-Powered Rest Station.
You begin the docking sequence.
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Is there a way to check remaining ammo
left in cargo? "Cargo" just shows weight, which isn't crazy useful."
[Newbie Help] Lily Kaise transmits, "Yes, go to the store room and look at the
box."
[Newbie Help] Lily Kaise transmits, "The ammunition box."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "What is 'max engine speed' on main
battery? You'd think it's what it says, but mine has a max speed of 4000, and I
was going 5500 a second ago."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Max engine speed on the main battery is
the starting speed of the engine, well better put."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Better put, the lower of the engine's
starting speed, and the main battery's max speed will be the starting speed, as
you move a great enough distance you'll accelerate to the max engine speed on
the engine itself."
[Newbie Help] Lily Kaise transmits, "Right and it will depend on the engine you
have installed as well as the battery/Charger."
[Newbie Help] Elaine Moreau transmits, "Thanks much."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

You peer out...
[League Rapid Recharging Eatery & Battery-Powered Rest Station; Docking Bay]
A small, basic docking bay is the core of the station, along with the life
support system and resource storage. Small hatches lead to the other station
modules.
The four-person combat support carrier "Future Crimes", the vostok-class capsule
"Dreaming Without You", the luxury sightseer "Rotten Apple", the four-person
Accord space module transport "Concertoed Effort", the two-person light corvette
"Birds Of A Feather", the one-person runabout "Graceful In Flight", the
one-person runabout "Highland Sprinter", the long-range sightseer "Blazer", the
luxury sightseer "Hummingbird's Migration", the long-range sightseer "Liberty
Bell", the one-person runabout "Free Spirit", the one-person runabout "Sincap",
the one-person runabout "Acceleration", the one-person runabout "Jammer", the
long-range sightseer "Huntin For Hen's Teeth", the one-person runabout "Schraft
Craft", the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", and the one-person runabout
"Heart Of Jade" are parked here.
You see a sheet of pink paper here.
You can go north, south, up, and down.

[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "What is the command to use the
hypercaster? I'm in a room supposedly with a hypercaster, but when I type
hypercaster and a message I get an error that says I don't understand that. Do I
need a certain amount of points?"
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Type hyper status to see what it's
commands are, and it's hyper transmit or hyper tra to transmit."
[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "No, that doesn't work either, but the
room commands lists hypercaster as one of them."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Tr hyper maybe?"
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Ah, I follow now. Check the ships
status to see if there indeed is a hypercaster."
[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "I'm not on a ship. I'm at the recharge
station."
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Oh. In that case, that is used from
the control room of the station."
[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "Yep that's where I am. And neither hyper
status or hyper tra works."
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "In that case I'm not 100% sure. I
thought those commands worked on station hypercasters as well. I'm more used to
ship hypercasters though, so I could be totally wrong."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "It's tr hyper message I think."
[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "No, that's hyperwave. Different thing."
[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "I think it's the same thing. Now I'm
confused. If it's not the same thing, then you don't need a transmitter for
hypercast, my communicator has commands for hypercast for some reason."
[Newbie Help] Sarah Bellamy transmits, "It's not the same thing. I just used
hypercaster in an actual ship. And it's not the same thing."

anything in the help files about hypercast."

y

on the side and quickly don them.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
[Outside Celestial Explorer]
You can go in any direction using a spacejet, or return to Celestial Explorer.
You are weightless here.
You carefully open the hatch and float outside.

l
[Outside Celestial Explorer]
You float above the starship's brightly-shining hull, which at this distance
blocks off a large portion of your view of space.  The glint of stars reflects
from the hull.  The reflection is occasionally distorted by various weapons
scars or pockmarks.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet, or return to Celestial Explorer.
You are weightless here.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
vector n
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
I don't understand that.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
vector n
You make a selection on the AutoVector control board.

l
[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.

[Newbie Help] Kim Saunders transmits, "Do you mean a social or an emote? Start
with tr channel name, like tr gen and then social, or what morris said, tr gen :
followed by an emote."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "No like...tra gen :claps happily."

green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
[Newbie Help] Kim Saunders transmits, "Or like tr gen giggle."

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The computer reports the presence of an artifact.
The starship transitions into another sector.
Proper in-sector coordinates not reached.  AutoVector program aborted.

wait.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
Are you sure you wish to leave the ship for a spacewalk?

[Outside Celestial Explorer]
You float above the starship's brightly-shining hull, which at this distance
blocks off a large portion of your view of space.  The glint of stars reflects
from the hull.  The reflection is occasionally distorted by various weapons
scars or pockmarks.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet, or return to Celestial Explorer.
You are weightless here.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
mir
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
enter
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
enter
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
vector n
You make a selection on the AutoVector control board.

players coming to the game!

quest

 TIP: Did you know that you can use audible social commands on your
communicator? Try typing TRANSMIT LAUGH!

[Newbie Help] Pilot Katie Celayla transmits, "Do phones pick up emotes?"
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Audible ones, yes."
[Newbie Help] Pilot Katie Celayla transmits, "Could you give me an example?"
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Anything you can hear. Laughing,
coughing, etc."
[Newbie Help] Eli Grey transmits, "Like a laugh or a chuckle could be heard, but
a grin could not be."

your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.

your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large PANEL of environmental controls here. Lights overhead indicate
that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in space. The hatch appears to be locked. A small, gently pulsing red
light near the hatch marks that the airlock currently possesses a hostile
environment.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."
enter

drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You see a disk of metal with an ornate design here.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.

You put a disk of metal with an ornate design in a leather briefcase.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
mir

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]

glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device

as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.

your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.

green.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.
You can go enter into the ship.
You float close to the luxury sightseer "Celestial Explorer", open the hatch,
and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle

your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."

ftl 275
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Alpha 275."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
[0m04:28[0m
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
The starship has entered a unique area of space.
Bits of starships of alien design and other assorted junk litter space in this
area. Oddly, judging from some of the debris that the ship can detect in the
distance, this was the site not only of a naval battle but of some sort of
space-based infantry engagement.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.
move
AutoStar detects 30 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
--

i
 You are wearing a gold spacesuit helmet, a black shipsuit with silver trim
around the collar and cuffs, a black spacesuit top with a red star on the right
shoulder, a pair of black spacesuit gloves with a gold stripe around each cuff,
a black spacesuit bottom with a red stripe down the outside of each leg, and a
pair of black spacesuit boots with a gold stripe down each side. Underneath
this, you are wearing a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers and a pair of
white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather
phone holster, a backpack, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a reactionless
spacesuit jet, and a spacesuit navaid. You are concealing a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the
side, a leather briefcase, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a
flight control scanner, and a black engineering tool case. Your face and both
eyes are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

[0m[Miriani] [General Communication] Allon Martellato transmits, "Hey, you
specifically asked someone to run mods so you could repair their ship. I could
bring back the comm log if you'd like."[0m
He appears to be 27 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His mid-back length, straight hair
is blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large
brownish fingernails.
 He is wearing a black shipsuit with silver trim around the collar and cuffs and
a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. He is also wearing a keychain, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
black leather phone holster, a backpack, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
His head, face, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "Concertoed Effort"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at League Rapid Recharging Eatery & Battery-Powered Rest Station;
Docking Bay.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair here.
You can go north and south.
peer u
You peer up...
[Starship "Concertoed Effort"; Living Quarters Block]
This room leads to the living quarters, and contains some additional amenities,
notably a tiny alcove containing a shower. A small keypad controls access to the
living quarters. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at League Rapid Recharging
Eatery & Battery-Powered Rest Station; Docking Bay.
You see a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding trough and a large leather couch
here.
You can go north, east, south, west, and down.

help communicators
--
Star Conquest Help: Metachannel Communicators
--
Category: Communication
--
Each character starts the game possessing a metachannel FTL communicator. This
allows people to transmit on the set of channels viewable only by their alliance
as well as the Tactical and General channels, open to all alliances. Also, the
Newbie channel is available through this device.
To use them, the following commands are used.  (Please note that you must be
wearing the communicator and it must be on.  It must also be YOUR communicator. 
Do not give your communicator to another player, or swap it.  This will stop the
communicators working, as they are assigned to the person in question both ICly
and OOCly.)
To turn the communicator on and off completely, the command TURN COMM is used.
To turn the Newbie channel on or off, NEWB COMM is used.
To turn the General channel on and off, GEN COMM is used.
To turn the Tactical channel on and off, TAC COMM is used.
To transmit on the Newbie channel, use the command TRANSMIT NEWBIE message (this
can be shortened to TRA NEWB message)
Example: TRA NEWB How do I communicate with people?
Result: [Newbie Help] Cameron Jellas transmits, "How do I communicate with
people?"
To transmit on the General channel, use the command TRANSMIT GENERAL message 
(this can be shortened to TRA GEN message)
Example: TRA GEN Hello.
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington transmits, "Hello."
To transmit on the Tactical channel, use the command TRANSMIT TACTICAL message
(this can be shortened to TRA TAC message)
Example: TRA TAC There are Battle Thralls in sector 26!
Result: [Tactical Communication] Ella Lerini transmits, "There are Battle
Thralls in sector 26!"
The channels specific to your alliance are slightly different.
You can TUNE COMM TO NUMBER, where NUMBER is a channel number from 1 to 10, to
transmit on that channel using the command TRA message.
Example: TUNE COMM TO 1
Result: You tune a metachannel communicator to ALLIANCE | Channel 1.
Example: TRA Hello.
Result: [ALLIANCE | Channel 1] Faye Masters transmits, "Hello."
You can also TUNE COMM TO 0 (the number zero) which puts the communicator in
tuner mode, allowing you to hear transmissions on all of your alliance channels.
 However, this means that the command to transmit to those channels is slightly
different.  Since the comm is no longer tuned to a specific channel, you must
specify the particular channel number you wish to transmit to.
Example: TUNE COMM TO 0
Result: You tune a metachannel communicator to the ALLIANCE tuner.
Example: TRA 1 Hello.
Result: [ALLIANCE | Channel 1] Georgina Norrington transmits, "Hello."
You can also use social commands with your communicator by simply transmitting
the command, or emotes by transmitting a normal emote command.
Example: TRA GEN laugh
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington laughs.
Example: TRA GEN :snorts and then laughs.
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington snorts and then laughs.
Note that your character is physically speaking into the communicator -- anyone
in the room with you will hear any transmission made by you.
If you wish to have a private conversation with someone, your character will
need a device called an einrophone.
--
mir
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

[Starship "Happy"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Rapid Recharging Eatery &
Battery-Powered Rest Station; Docking Bay.
You see a soft oval mauve rug with a luxuriously deep pile and thick gold
fringe, an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored patchwork fabric
with a soft sky blue brocade pillow with thick gold fringe on it, a glossy
sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a small dusky pink trash bin, and KitCat
the humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
'ok, let's go lie down.
You say, "Ok, let's go lie down."

tiny startlingly humanoid creature with orange skin and violet butterfly-like
wings, a tiny startlingly humanoid creature with red skin and violet
butterfly-like wings, a tiny startlingly humanoid creature with crimson skin and
violet butterfly-like wings, and a tiny startlingly humanoid creature with taupe
skin and violet round wings are living in it.

 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 Consider voting for Star Conquest at MUD listing sites! Votes help keep new
players coming to the game!
 The Mud Connector: http://www.mudconnect.com/mud-bin/vote_rank.cgi?mud=Star+Con
quest
 Top Mud Sites:     http://www.topmudsites.com/vote-sc.html

 TIP: Your hair will grow over time, as will your beard... unless you're a girl,
then hopefully you do not have to worry about the beard. If you hate your beard,
Beard-B-Gone is also available.

[Starship "Happy"; Storage Room]
You see a dark violet fabric loveseat with a large white quilt with an appliqued
fuchsia and turquoise lotus blossom design on it, a large square purple and
light purple cloth rug, a small oval dusky pink rattan table with a glass top, a
dark violet fabric armchair, Meow the little calico CatBot, a glossy silver
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing
white and fuchsia aquatic life and coral rocks, a wall-sized bubbling neon
purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a
small bubbling neon blue-lit toroidal aquarium containing red and blue aquatic
life and round rocks, a large bubbling azure blue-lit aquarium containing violet
and ocher aquatic life and round rocks, a small bubbling white-lit aquarium
containing crimson and taupe aquatic life and round rocks, Magellan the
arachnoid security robot, a compact red refrigerator, a compact white
refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, an insulated white cooler, and a
robotic chef named Nellie here.
You can go north and south.

from the various starship systems.

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.

ftl 275
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Alpha 275."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

modules.

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a
glossy red ceramic felo chow bowl, and an early warning space defense device
here.

and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit the floor
as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from red to yellow. Through
your suit, you gradually begin to hear the hiss of air entering the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
green.
The computer announces, "Cycling complete."

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
vector sw
The starship is already moving.

[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.

[Deep Space]
The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.
You can go in any direction using a spacejet.
You are weightless here.

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
launch
There is little point in launching, since the ship is already in space.

[Newbie Help] Kert On'Marr transmits, "Excellent. Thanks. And I just tried and
didn't get any responses in character so, I learned this from some tech when I
bought it apparently."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Aerial fortresses do not actually go inside
the mule at all. They clamp to the underside, as implied in the text when it
detaches and reattaches. Though it is easy to miss and never really made
explicit anywhere! But now you know!"
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Ha. You learn something new every day.
It makes sense, but I hadn't thought of it."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "How do they avoid being shot during ship
to ship combat?"
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "I'm actually curious about that in
general, cause I've always understood that docking with temp stations worked the
same way."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Through your very clever evasive flying.
Well done, Erik!"
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "Haha."
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah chuckles.
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Ships do actually go inside temp stations."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Hence the docking bay."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Though in the original version of them from
years ago, you could also attach docking modules to dock externally. But it was
never used because there was no real reason to ever do that."
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "I am learning more interesting things.
I like this."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "Ah, okay. I remember asking when I was
new to the game and being told they just connect to airlock modules on the side.
I think my particular question was how it was that a station module transport
could carry all those modules and still fit inside a station. I guess the size
changes a lot once you fill the thing with atmosphere."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Now I'm curious who told you that. Heh."
[Newbie Help] Ted Warburton transmits, "You know, I was pondering the whole mod
transport the other day, when we build 3 stations from one transport, and now
each of them holds many ships, including that mod transport."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Temp stations are made from expanding memory
metal and also partially just inflatable. Like rescue pods! I suppose that's
another thing not made explicit anywhere."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "I always wondered that about rescue pods
too. Specifically because of capsules. Where the heck would you put a rescue pod
in a capsule?!"
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "The rescue pods being inflatable is in a
help file...somewhere."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "Oh, in the aptly named rescue pods help
file."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Is it? I don't recall seeing that, but I
don't have them memorized...thank goodness."
[Newbie Help] Evenia Callseah transmits, "My image of stations suddenly swelling
up like massive hot air balloons from that has made my morning. Thanks, glorious
mind of the squid."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew laughs. "Yeah, same."
[Newbie Help] Ted Warburton transmits, "I suppose it does say that it pops out."
[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "It's hinted at in how the station has to
float a bit away from the ship before it comes online."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Memory metal is a real life thing, if you're
not familiar! Metal that has one shape, then transitions to a different shape
when a current is applied."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Now see I always thought that was just
because the station obviously can't occupy the same coordinates as the ship."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Yeah, they make eyeglass frames out of
the stuff."
[Newbie Help] Squidmind transmits, "Inflatable spaceships aren't that outlandish
either. The lunar lander had walls as thin as tin foil."
[Newbie Help] Ted Warburton transmits, "Yeah, they are trying to make more and
more that way."

[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for
the large starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the
viewport is the main control board, providing essential functions like the
shipwide power lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up
and folded back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses
overhead as needed. There is not really enough room for anyone to comfortably
stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged
around it. Most of the space aboard the small shuttle is dedicated to cargo.
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in space.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers", a wormhole
drive tracer, a glossy silvery gray ceramic felo chow bowl, and a silky cerulean
cushion decorated with embroidered dark red dragons here.
You can go south and out.
peer nw
You peer northwest but see nothing of interest.

thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A small rectangular transparisteel viewport provides a view out
the front of the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for

stand here; there is only room for the pilot's chair and the controls arranged

[Newbie Help] Erik Goodwin transmits, "The point of the profile is to help you
with your roleplaying."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "I mean, if you want to stay a cadet
forever, that's fine. But you will never have access to many things. You can be
a cadet forever if you want, but you will still want some points."
[Newbie Help] Dorothy Miller transmits, "But profiles are too hard."
[Newbie Help] Pilot Katie Celayla transmits, "And if we're being honest with
ourselves, people will respect/treat you better after you get past cadet, as it
shows you know what you're talking about."
[Newbie Help] Kim Saunders transmits, "The profile is all about roleplaying,
even though it allows you to earn more points after you have it approved. For
further information you could of course always speak with the staff using a
support ticket, because they can give you more information on what you wish to
do than we can."
[Newbie Help] Lily Kaise transmits, "Also, if you consider a Profile to be too
hard, then how do you consider that you will be able to rP a well-developed
character?"
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Profiles are something that will allow
you to roleplay more, in a much more dynamic way. Yes, they can be difficult,
but you have a mentor and staff who can assist you. Pay close attention to what
staff tell you in their responses."
[Newbie Help] Ted Warburton transmits, "The hard part, if you ask me, is
actually the character concept, I'm not sure how I would have got through that
bit to be quite honest."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "I wish we'd had that when I was new. It
would have saved me a good bit of frustration with my first profile being
rejected."
[Newbie Help] Pilot Katie Celayla transmits, "Its a blessing and a curse in that
once you get that approved first time, the 6 attempts at a profile are... a test
of pacients, to be sure."
[Newbie Help] Evelyn Devereaux transmits, "I wish profiles were easier I need a
fresh new one."
[Newbie Help] Ted Warburton transmits, "The profile is very helpful as a way of
giving you many props on which to base your RP, and act consistently."
[Newbie Help] Evelyn Devereaux transmits, "No its not helpful for me, roleplay
for me is just imagining and exploring."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Imagine and explore your character, and
put that into a profile."
[Newbie Help] Evelyn Devereaux transmits, "I do beautiful writing but not the
way its wanted here.\."
[Newbie Help] Kim Saunders transmits, "I would always explain the profile as a
writing of who my character is."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "So adapt your beautiful writing to what
they're asking for."
